result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John P. Wright was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:25 pm case called. Defendant John P. Wright in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zilles. No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 54 months Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 24 month years Intial Confinement and 30 month Extended Supervision. 117 days credit for time served. CONDITIONS of ES: $1800 fine inclusive of costs, to be paid from 25% of inmate earnings, balance to be paid during ES. 36 months DL revocation, 36 month IID, OWI Assessment. AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No Bars, Not to possess any impairing substances without a valid prescription from a treating physician. Defendant is not eligible for CIP but is eligible for SAP.  Bond to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on January 28, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Case Called @ 2:00 PM: Defendant John P. Wright in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of PSI report - no material errors offered.  Court addresses counsel as to candidacy for TAD Court.   Atty Zilles states referral has not yet been addressed with Def - counsel was not fully aware that defense could initiate referral.  Statement as to referral process by DA.  Off Record at 2:10 PM to discuss TAD referral with Def.  Back of Record @ 2:16 PM:  Per Atty Zilles - application will be filed for TAD program. Counsel agree to allow Court to order PSI be made available to TAD Coordinator, COMPAS eval already performed, will expedite her evaluation after review of same.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Case called @ 2:42 p.m. Defendant John P. Wright in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright.  Based on the request of the parties, the Court orders preparation of a PSI. Bond revoked - Defendant remanded to custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
from Atty Zilles Re: Adjournment of 9/17/14 P/S Hrg - Request granted by the Court
Plea hearing on September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 9, 2014 at 02:50 pm.

3:17 pm case called. Defendant John P. Wright in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Steven P Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Information Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Statement by Attorney Zilles regarding bond modification. Court respectfully declines motion for modification.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 02:50 pm.
Amended
State's
Exhibit 1
Arraignment on May 7, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.

Case called @ 11:03 a.m. Defendant John P. Wright in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Defendant John P. Wright in custody.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Eagan sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by DA Blader. Exhibit 1 marked and entered. Cross exam by Atty Zilles. Witness excused. The court finds that probable cause has been established. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Atty Zilles requesting another date for arraignment. Motion by Atty Zilles for modification of bond to $1500. Objection by DA Blader. The court grants modification of bond to $1500 Cash Bond.  Arraignment scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called @ 1:57 p.m. Defendant John P. Wright in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Defendant John P. Wright in custody.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The defendant is requesting a preliminary hearing. Motion by Atty Zilles for bond reduction. DA Blader voices an objection to any amendment in bond. The court declines to modify the bond in any way. Preliminary Hearing Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's
Initial appearance on April 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license. Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.

Case called @ 1:12 p.m. Defendant John P. Wright in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD based on qualification which will be determined after court. ADA Anderson requesting $2000 Cash Bond w/ conditions. Atty Keberlein requesting lower cash bond or signature bond. Court orders $2500 Cash Bond w/ conditions. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
